name: Thorin Oakenshield
description: The leader of the group and heir to the Kingdom under the Mountain. Thorin is a strong, authoritative figure with a deep sense of honor and justice, seeking to reclaim his homeland from the dragon Smaug.

name: Balin
description: An older, wise dwarf who serves as Thorin's chief advisor. Balin is distinguished by his white beard and thoughtful demeanor, providing wisdom and counsel throughout their journey.

name: Dwalin
description: Balin’s brother, known for his formidable fighting skills and loyalty to Thorin. Dwalin is often seen wielding a battle axe and is one of the fiercest warriors in the group.

name: Fíli
description: One of the youngest dwarves, nephew to Thorin. Fíli is known for his sharp shooting with a bow and arrow. He and his brother Kíli often inject a youthful, adventurous spirit into the company.

name: Kíli
description: Fíli’s brother and the youngest member of the company. Kíli is bold and charismatic, also skilled in archery, and plays a significant role in the camaraderie and morale of the group.

name: Dori
description: A strong dwarf who often ends up carrying the burden, literally and figuratively. Dori is noted for his strength and reliability, often tasked with looking out for the well-being of others, especially the wizard Gandalf’s favorite, Bilbo Baggins.

name: Nori
description: Known for his peculiar way with secrets and locks, Nori is a bit of a rogue within the group, often involved in scouting and stealth tasks.

name: Ori
description: A scribe among the dwarves, Ori often documents the journey. He is characterized by his quieter, more scholarly nature compared to his more warrior-like brethren.

name: Óin
description: An older dwarf, brother to Glóin, and skilled in fire-making. Óin plays a crucial role in the survival of the group in hostile environments.

name: Glóin
description: Father of Gimli (who appears in 'The Lord of the Rings'), Glóin is concerned with the financial aspects of the expedition to reclaim the Lonely Mountain and is a fierce warrior in his own right.

name: Bifur
description: Distinguished by a piece of orc axe stuck in his skull, which causes him some confusion at times. Bifur often communicates only in Khuzdul, the dwarven language.

name: Bofur
description: Bifur’s cousin, known for his good humor and optimism. Bofur wears a distinctive yellow hood and plays the flute.

name: Bombur
description: Bofur’s brother, notable for his immense size and appetite. Despite his bulk, Bombur is an essential part of the company, often providing comic relief.
